cip.render.raytrace.material.texture

Class Outlined

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.ADynamicNamedObject
      • cip.render.raytrace.material.texture.ATexture
        • cip.render.raytrace.material.texture.ADualMaterialTexture
          • cip.render.raytrace.material.texture.Outlined
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtMaterial

    public class Outlined
extends ADualMaterialTexture
    Maps every unit square (in 2D) or cube (in 3D) into either an outline material or an infill material. Within each mapped square or cube, the textures coordinates are normalized to be in the 0,0,0 to 1,1,1 range.

    The outlined mapping is specified as:

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.material.texture.Checkerboard"
                              name="myCheckerboard">
         <width>outlineWidth</width>
         <width>outlineWidthX,outlineWidthY,outlineWidthZ</width>
         <outlineMtl>
             <MaterialByRef name="materialName"/>
             <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="materialClass">
                   .
                 material specific nodes and attributes
                   .
             </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
         </outlineMtl>
         <infillMtl>
             <MaterialByRef name="materialName"/>
             <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="materialClass">
                   .
                 material specific nodes and attributes
                   .
             </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
         </infillMtl>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    where:
    width The width of the outline. This is specified either as a single value which is applied to i, j, and k; or as 3 values that will be applied to i, j, and k individually. The default width in i, j, and i is 0.1f if not specified.
    outlineMtl The outline material.
    infillMtl The in-fill material.
    MaterialByRef A material specified by reference to the name of a previously loaded material. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. If no material is specified the mapping will generate an exception during rendering.
    DynamicallyLoadedObject The specification for one of the materials of the outline texture. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. The dynamically loaded object must implement the IRtMaterial interface. If no material is specified the mapping will generate an exception during rendering.

    Since:
    1.0

      • getColor

        public void getColor(@NotNull
                     @NotNull RGBf rgb,
                     @NotNull
                     @NotNull RayIntersection intersection,
                     @NotNull
                     @NotNull IRtLight[] lights,
                     @NotNull
                     @NotNull IRtGeometry[] rtObjects,
                     @NotNull
                     @NotNull IRtBackground rtBkg,
                     int nMaxRecursions,
                     int nSample,
                     int nRandom)
        Description copied from interface: IRtMaterial
        Compute the colour of a surface as seen from a specific direction.
        Parameters:
        rgb - (modified) The computed colour at the surface.
        intersection - (readonly) The description of the surface - location, orientation, material, etc.
        lights - (readonly) The light in the scene that may affect the intersection.
        rtObjects - (readonly) The objects in the scene.
        rtBkg - (readonly) The background description.
        nMaxRecursions - The maximum reflections to be followed in computing this colour.
        nSample - The pixel sub-sample index. This is used in distributed ray-tracing to make sure the correct sample displacement is used for samples that are distributed.
        nRandom - The jitter array index..
